docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
docs.title: Commands

docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: 🧹 How to Clear Your Browser Cache Over time, your browser stores data (images, scripts, etc.) to load websites faster. This can cause problems when trying to view updated content or fix login issues. Here’s how to clear cache in major browsers: 🌐 Google Chrome Open Chrome. Press Ctrl + Shift + Delete or go to chrome://settings/clearBrowserData Set Time Range to All time . Check Cached images and files . Click Clear data . 🦊 Mozilla Firefox Open Firefox. Press Ctrl + Shift + Delete or go to about:preferences#privacy Click Clear Data under Cookies and Site Data . Check Cached Web Content . Click Clear . 🧿 Microsoft Edge Open Edge. Press Ctrl + Shift + Delete or go to edge://settings/clearBrowserData Choose All time for the time range. Select Cached images and files . Click Clear now . 💡 Tip: Clearing the cache does not delete passwords or browsing history , unless selected.
docs.title: Clear Browser Cache

docs.text: Over time, your browser stores data (images, scripts, etc.) to load websites faster. This can cause problems when trying to view updated content or fix login issues. Here’s how to clear cache in major browsers:
docs.title: 🧹 How to Clear Your Browser Cache

docs.text: Open Chrome. Press Ctrl + Shift + Delete or go to chrome://settings/clearBrowserData Set Time Range to All time . Check Cached images and files . Click Clear data .
docs.title: 🌐 Google Chrome

docs.text: Open Firefox. Press Ctrl + Shift + Delete or go to about:preferences#privacy Click Clear Data under Cookies and Site Data . Check Cached Web Content . Click Clear .
docs.title: 🦊 Mozilla Firefox

docs.text: Open Edge. Press Ctrl + Shift + Delete or go to edge://settings/clearBrowserData Choose All time for the time range. Select Cached images and files . Click Clear now . 💡 Tip: Clearing the cache does not delete passwords or browsing history , unless selected.
docs.title: 🧿 Microsoft Edge

docs.text: 🖥️ Install Software via PowerShell PowerShell can automate the installation of common software using package managers like Winget or Chocolatey . 🚀 Method 1: Using Winget (Built-in for Windows 10/11) ✅ Example: Install Google Chrome winget install --id=Google.Chrome --source=winget ----------------------------Common apps--------------------------- VS Code winget install --id=Microsoft.VisualStudioCode Zoom winget install --id=Zoom.Zoom 7-Zip winget install --id=7zip.7zip Firefox winget install --id=Mozilla.Firefox VLC Media Player winget install --id=VideoLAN.VLC -------------------------------------------------------------------- ## 📦 Method 2: Using Chocolatey (Requires Installation) ``` 🛠️ Install Chocolatey (Run in Admin PowerShell) "Set-ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Scope Process -Force; ` [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = ` [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol -bor 3072; ` iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://chocolatey.org/install.ps1'))" ### ✅ Example: Install Notepad++ with Chocolatey (Powersehell) "choco install notepadplusplus -y" ⚠️ Note: -Winget comes with most Windows 10/11 systems. -Chocolatey needs admin access and initial setup.
docs.title: Install Software via PowerShell

docs.text: PowerShell can automate the installation of common software using package managers like Winget or Chocolatey .

docs.text: winget install --id=Google.Chrome --source=winget ----------------------------Common apps--------------------------- VS Code winget install --id=Microsoft.VisualStudioCode Zoom winget install --id=Zoom.Zoom 7-Zip winget install --id=7zip.7zip Firefox winget install --id=Mozilla.Firefox VLC Media Player winget install --id=VideoLAN.VLC -------------------------------------------------------------------- ## 📦 Method 2: Using Chocolatey (Requires Installation) ``` 🛠️ Install Chocolatey (Run in Admin PowerShell) "Set-ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Scope Process -Force; ` [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = ` [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol -bor 3072; ` iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://chocolatey.org/install.ps1'))" ### ✅ Example: Install Notepad++ with Chocolatey (Powersehell) "choco install notepadplusplus -y" ⚠️ Note: -Winget comes with most Windows 10/11 systems. -Chocolatey needs admin access and initial setup.
docs.title: ✅ Example: Install Google Chrome

docs.text: 🖥️ Reset a Forgotten Windows Password If a user forgets their Windows password, follow these steps: 🔄 Option 1: Safe Mode with Command Prompt Restart the PC and press F8 before Windows loads. Select Safe Mode with Command Prompt . Enter the following command: net user USERNAME NEWPASSWORD Example: net user JohnDoe NewPassword123 🔄 Option 2: Using Windows Recovery Hold Shift and click Restart . Go to Troubleshoot > Advanced Options > Command Prompt . Type: net user Then: net user USERNAME NEWPASSWORD ✅ You’ve successfully reset the password!
docs.title: Reset Forgotten Password

docs.text: If a user forgets their Windows password, follow these steps:
